project.name: J-C543A-CMUD-03-ST03-DT02-DF11-CF17-01
project.description: This weakness takes an integer, two file names, and an integer "int file1 file2 int" as an input. The first integer is the size of the array to sort for timing in benign cases without FIFO files as inputs. The two files are used for thread "scheduling", if they are FIFO files in the order "fifo1 fifo2" with respect to the input script the weakness will occur, and if they are in reverse order the weakness will not occur. If the files are given as normal files, the weakness is dependent on the quicksort where a low quicksort value is nondeterministic and a larger value will increase the likelihood that the weakness will not occur. The final integer is the number of Fibonacci values to calculate and print. This weakness uses a singleton class to pass the Fibonacci values between the thread calculating them and the thread printing them. The method of instantiating a singleton used contains a race condition that can lead to multiple instances of the class being instantiated, leading to deadlock.

iopair.name: J-C543A-CMUD-03-ST03-DT02-DF11-CF17-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: register a character, become an archon (essentially a superuser), destroy character Environment variable defining string value.

process.script: dd if=/dev/urandom count=1 bs=512 2> /dev/null | tr -dc 'a-zA-Z0-9' | fold -w 5 | head -1 >/tmp/screen_name.txt; cat /tmp/screen_name.txt

sleep 22 && screen -dmSL ${SS_SCREEN_NAME//[$'\t\r\n ']} "$SS_TC_DEPS/bin/tt++" "$SS_TC_ROOT/testData/good-01/good_01.tin"; while [[ `screen -ls` == *${SS_SCREEN_NAME//[$'\t\r\n ']}* ]]; do sleep 1; done;

/opt/stonesoup/workspace/scripts/service_mon.sh ss-localhost 8887 && curl -v --data-urlencode data="5000000 /opt/stonesoup/workspace/testData/file1 /opt/stonesoup/workspace/testData/file2 50" --header "If-Match: weak_taint_source_value" --request POST --no-buffer --output /opt/stonesoup/workspace/testData/logfile.txt --silent --show-error http://ss-localhost:8887
kill $(ps aux | grep 'coffee_mud' | grep -v 'grep' | awk '{print $2}'); echo "Killed coffee_mud"; date

scoring_formula.formula: GOOD-01-01 AND GOOD-01-02 AND GOOD-01-03 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

iopair.name: J-C543A-CMUD-03-ST03-DT02-DF11-CF17-01-GOOD-02
iopair.description: register character, become archon, check inventory, destroy character Environment variable defining string value.

process.script: dd if=/dev/urandom count=1 bs=512 2> /dev/null | tr -dc 'a-zA-Z0-9' | fold -w 5 | head -1 >/tmp/screen_name.txt; cat /tmp/screen_name.txt

$SS_TC_ROOT/scripts/service_mon.sh ss-localhost 5555 && sleep 22 && screen -dmSL ${SS_SCREEN_NAME//[$'\t\r\n ']} "$SS_TC_DEPS/bin/tt++" "$SS_TC_ROOT/testData/good-02/good_02.tin"; while [[ `screen -ls` == *${SS_SCREEN_NAME//[$'\t\r\n ']}* ]]; do sleep 1; done;

/opt/stonesoup/workspace/scripts/service_mon.sh ss-localhost 8887 && curl -v --data-urlencode data="42 /opt/stonesoup/workspace/testData/fifo2 /opt/stonesoup/workspace/testData/fifo1 42" --header "If-Match: weak_taint_source_value" --request POST --no-buffer --output /opt/stonesoup/workspace/testData/logfile.txt --silent --show-error http://ss-localhost:8887
kill $(ps aux | grep 'coffee_mud' | grep -v 'grep' | awk '{print $2}'); echo "Killed coffee_mud"; date

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/preprocess_daemon_script_01.pid") && echo "Killed script."; else echo "Failed: Script PID file does not exist."; fi

scoring_formula.formula: GOOD-02-01 AND GOOD-02-02 AND GOOD-02-03 AND GOOD-02-04 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

(NOT PERFORMER AND (timeout_iRNGncvNWw OR (NOT finished_p1ycglAJjw AND NOT (controlled_exit_pOd5AzpXE7 OR continued_execution_hcj7xUAugd)))) or (PERFORMER AND NOT ((timeout_iRNGncvNWw OR (NOT finished_p1ycglAJjw AND NOT (controlled_exit_pOd5AzpXE7 OR continued_execution_hcj7xUAugd))) OR controlled_exit_pOd5AzpXE7))

output_checks.simple_check: if (( $(/bin/grep "Info: Threads ended" "logfile.txt" | wc -l) > 0 )); then true; else false; fi;
